com.camerontec.catalys.server.schedule

Class TimeSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.schedule.TimeSpec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITimeSpec, AlarmListener, Cloneable, Comparable<TimeSpec>

    public class TimeSpec
extends Object
implements ITimeSpec, AlarmListener, Cloneable, Comparable<TimeSpec>
    Implementation of ITimeSpec based on the JDRing package.

    Note that the TimeSpec is "activated" by calling getAlarmEntry. At that point, a JDRing AlarmEntry is created and scheduled if one does not exist already.

    Once the AlarmEntry is created, the TimeSpec will fire events to its listener whenever the time it represents is matched.

      • getNextScheduledTime

        public long getNextScheduledTime()
        Returns the next scheduled time of this TimeSpec.

        Value returned is standard milliseconds since 1/1/1970. If the time spec is not currently scheduled, returns -1.

        Specified by:
        getNextScheduledTime in interface ITimeSpec
        Returns:
        Time of next scheduled event or -1 if none.

      • isMatch

        @Deprecated
public boolean isMatch(Date time)
        Deprecated. useisMatch(Calendar) instead.
        Description copied from interface: ITimeSpec
        True if the given time (an absolute GMT time) matches this TimeSpec. To match the time needs to be converted to the timezone used by this timespec and then compared against its various values, taking account of wild cards.
        Specified by:
        isMatch in interface ITimeSpec
        Parameters:
        time - Time to match against the TimeSpec.
        Returns:
        True if the given time is compatible with this TimeSpec.

      • isMatch

        public boolean isMatch(Calendar calendar)
        Checks if the given calendar matches the current TimeSpec.
        Parameters:
        calendar - calendar that will be checked against this TimeSpec.
        Returns:
        true if the calendar matches this TimeSpec, false otherwise.

      • isNextEnabled

        public boolean isNextEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: ITimeSpec
        True if the next scheduled event is enabled.

        If not, it will still occur but will its listener will not be notified. However, this flag will then be automatically set to true - thus enabling the new next event.

        Specified by:
        isNextEnabled in interface ITimeSpec
        Returns:
        True (default) if next event is enabled.

      • isRepetitive

        Description copied from interface: ITimeSpec

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        True it reoccurs.
